Package model

Interface ImageModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImageModelImpl, MockImageModel
    public interface ImageModel
    The interface defines a set of operations that can be performed on the images. It provides operations like loading, saving, and applying transformations to images, changing color components, flipping, brightening, filter, and transformations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void applyBlueComponent​(java.lang.String imageName, java.lang.String newImageName)
      Creates a new image that has only the blue component of the image.
      void applyGreenComponent​(java.lang.String imageName, java.lang.String newImageName)
      Creates a new image that has only the green component of the image.
      void applyIntensity​(java.lang.String imageName, java.lang.String newImageName)
      Creates a new image with the intensity component of the original image.
      void applyLuma​(java.lang.String imageName, java.lang.String newImageName)
      Creates a new image with the luma component of the original image.
      void applyRedComponent​(java.lang.String imageName, java.lang.String newImageName)
      Creates a new image that has only the red component of the image.
      void applySepia​(java.lang.String imageName, java.lang.String newImageName)
      Applies a sepia tone to the image and creates a new image.
      void applyValue​(java.lang.String imageName, java.lang.String newImageName)
      Creates a new image with the value component of the original image.
      void blurImage​(java.lang.String imageName, java.lang.String newImageName)
      Blurs the original image and creates a new image.
      void brightenImage​(int increment, java.lang.String imageName, java.lang.String newImageName)
      Brightens or darkens the image by the given amount and creates a new image.
      void flipHorizontally​(java.lang.String imageName, java.lang.String newImageName)
      Flips the image horizontally and creates a new image.
      void flipVertically​(java.lang.String imageName, java.lang.String newImageName)
      Flips the image vertically and creates a new image.
      Image getImage​(java.lang.String imgName)
      Retrieves the image associated with the given name.
      void loadImage​(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String imageName)
      Loads an image from a file and gives it a name for future use.
      void rgbCombine​(java.lang.String newImageName, java.lang.String redImage, java.lang.String greenImage, java.lang.String blueImage)
      Combines three component images, red, green, and blue into a single new image.
      void rgbSplit​(java.lang.String imageName, java.lang.String redImage, java.lang.String greenImage, java.lang.String blueImage)
      Splits the image into three separate images for each of the red, green, and blue components.
      void saveImage​(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String imageName)
      Saves the image with the given name to a given file path.
      void sharpenImage​(java.lang.String imageName, java.lang.String newImageName)
      Sharpens the original image and creates a new image.

    • Method Detail

      • loadImage

        void loadImage​(java.lang.String path,
               java.lang.String imageName)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Loads an image from a file and gives it a name for future use.
        Parameters:
        path - the file path of the image to load.
        imageName - the name to assign to the loaded image.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem reading the file.

      • saveImage

        void saveImage​(java.lang.String path,
               java.lang.String imageName)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the image with the given name to a given file path.
        Parameters:
        path - the file path to save the image.
        imageName - the name of the image to save.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem writing the file.

        newImageName - the name of the new image with the red component.

      • brightenImage

        void brightenImage​(int increment,
                   java.lang.String imageName,
                   java.lang.String newImageName)
        Brightens or darkens the image by the given amount and creates a new image. Positive values brighten the image, negative values darken it.
        Parameters:
        increment - the amount to change the brightness.
        imageName - the name of the original image.
        newImageName - the name of the new image.

      • blurImage

        void blurImage​(java.lang.String imageName,
               java.lang.String newImageName)
        Blurs the original image and creates a new image.
        Parameters:
        imageName - the name of the original image.
        newImageName - the name of the new blurred image.

      • sharpenImage

        Sharpens the original image and creates a new image.
        Parameters:
        imageName - the name of the original image.
        newImageName - the name of the new blurred image.

        newImageName - the name of the new sepia image.

      • rgbSplit

        void rgbSplit​(java.lang.String imageName,
              java.lang.String redImage,
              java.lang.String greenImage,
              java.lang.String blueImage)
        Splits the image into three separate images for each of the red, green, and blue components.
        Parameters:
        imageName - the name of the original image.
        redImage - the name of the new red component image.
        greenImage - the name of the new green component image.
        blueImage - the name of the new blue component image.

      • rgbCombine

        void rgbCombine​(java.lang.String newImageName,
                java.lang.String redImage,
                java.lang.String greenImage,
                java.lang.String blueImage)
        Combines three component images, red, green, and blue into a single new image.
        Parameters:
        newImageName - the name of the new combined image.
        redImage - the name of the red component image.
        greenImage - the name of the green component image.
        blueImage - the name of the blue component image.

      • getImage

        Image getImage​(java.lang.String imgName)
        Retrieves the image associated with the given name.
        Parameters:
        imgName - the name of the image to get.
        Returns:
        returns the fetched image object.
